amendment.description: Amendment earmarks $2 million of NASA's life and microgravity sciences and applications authorization for research and early detection systems for breast and ovarian cancer and other women's health issues.
amendment.purpose: An amendment printed as amendment No. 4 in the Congressional Record of October 10, 1995 to require $2 million of the $293 million in funds authorized in the bill for NASA'S life and microgravity sciences research to be spent for research and early detection systems for breast and ovarian cancer and other women's health issues.

vote.text: On agreeing to the Dunn amendment (A002) Agreed to by voice vote.
